content.description:
Climb easily up and clip the first bolt of Ambient Groove, after which step right and head straight on up.

The crux is between the 2nd and 3rd bolt.  Powerful climbing gains a good flake on the face above.   The climbing continues to be steep and thin until the 5th bolt.
content.location: Right of center on the main face.  Climb is easily identified by the large ring bolts.

content.description: Start right of small pine tree on a bulge section which reaches a slabby ledge (optional 1" pro should you desire).  Enter into crack system that climbs up and through a cool flake which is likely the crux of the climb.
content.protection: 6 bolts with optional 1" gear to protect slab before reaching vertical climbing.  Two bolt anchor.
content.location: Furthest left route of the Right section of Wavy Gravy Wall.  Bulge just right of small pine tree.

climbs.name: Population Explosion
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron, Tim Kearns, Ryan DeBrun, 27th September 2009

content.description: Start up the steepening slab to clip the first bolt. Make a tricky sequence to pass the first bolt which gains easier ground. Climb up the slab until the 5th bolt which marks the start of the crux moves, passing the 5th and 6th bolts.
content.location:
Located 10 feet right of

Autumn Storm

.

content.description: Start to the right of Population Explosion. Climb past a bolt and some gear to an anchor.
content.protection: One bolt and gear to an anchor.
content.location: Start to the right of Population Explosion.

content.description:
Climb the slab on the left.

The start is steep, but soon eases to more normal slab climbing.
content.location: Located on the slab on the right, this line takes the left side.

content.description: Climb a left facing flake to the obvious roof at 1/3 height.   Surmount the roof and climb the face above.

Look for the large ring bolts on the slab on the right.

Passing the 2nd, 4th and 6th bolts provide the interest.
content.location: Located on the slab on the right of the crag.  This line takes the right bolted route.

content.description:
Start easily up the slab below the main face.   Clip the first bolt, move slightly left up to the overhang, clip the second and then pass the over hang and head up a shallow groove.

Clip the 3rd bolt and make powerful moves up and right along the quartz dike.

After the 5th bolt the climb eases, but the moss increases.
content.location: Climbs the left line on the main face.

content.description: Vertical crack and dihedral directly right of The Giving Tree route.  A bit heady at the beginning, but good protection at the vertical crack.  Followed by easy slab then a very dirty dihedral.    Think rock slings for pro at the dihedral.  You can traverse to the bolts at the top of The Giving Tree or top out and rap off the bolts of the surrounding routes.
content.protection: cams, nuts, rock slings.  use neighboring bolts on sport routes as there are no anchors at the top.  There are good features to make a trad anchor. No walk off so rap off surrounding route bolts.
content.location: Starts at vertical crack directly right of The Giving Tree.
